para.verbatim: Return whether the vcs prefix (e.g. "git+") should be added to a repository's remote url when used in a requirement.
Return the path to Python project root, relative to the repo root. Return None if the project root is in the repo root.
Return the revision string that should be used in a requirement.

Return the requirement string to use to redownload the files currently at the given repository directory.
Args: project_name: the (unescaped) project name.
The return value has a form similar to the following:
{repository_url}@{revision}#egg={project_name}

Return true if the commit hash checked out at dest matches the revision in url.
Always return False, if the VCS does not support immutable commit hashes.
This method does not check if there are local uncommitted changes in dest after checkout, as pip currently has no use case for that.

Return a RevOptions object.
Args: rev: the name of a revision to install. extra_args: a list of extra options.

Parse the repository URL's netloc, and return the new netloc to use along with auth information.
Args: netloc: the original repository URL netloc. scheme: the repository URL's scheme without the vcs prefix.
This is mainly for the Subversion class to override, so that auth information can be provided via the --username and --password options instead of through the URL. For other subclasses like Git without such an option, auth information must stay in the URL.
Returns: (netloc, (username, password)).

Parse the repository URL to use, and return the URL, revision, and auth info to use.
Returns: (url, rev, (username, password)).
Return the URL and RevOptions object to use in obtain(), as a tuple (url, rev_options).
Compare two repo URLs for identity, ignoring incidental differences.

memberdef.argsstring: (self, str dest, HiddenText url, RevOptions rev_options, int verbosity)
memberdef.name: fetch_new

para.verbatim:
Fetch a revision from a repository, in the case that this is the first fetch from the repository.
Args: dest: the directory to fetch the repository to. rev_options: a RevOptions object. verbosity: verbosity level.

memberdef.argsstring: (self, str dest, HiddenText url, RevOptions rev_options)
memberdef.name: switch

para.verbatim:
Switch the repo at ``dest`` to point to ``URL``.
Args: rev_options: a RevOptions object.

memberdef.argsstring: (self, str dest, HiddenText url, RevOptions rev_options)
memberdef.name: update

para.verbatim:
Update an already-existing repo to the given ``rev_options``.
Args: rev_options: a RevOptions object.

Return whether the id of the current commit equals the given name.
Args: dest: the repository directory. name: a string name.

memberdef.argsstring: (self, str dest, HiddenText url, int verbosity)
memberdef.name: obtain

para.verbatim:
Install or update in editable mode the package represented by this VersionControl object.
:param dest: the repository directory in which to install or update. :param url: the repository URL starting with a vcs prefix. :param verbosity: verbosity level.

memberdef.argsstring: (self, str location, HiddenText url, int verbosity)
memberdef.name: unpack

para.verbatim:
Clean up current location and download the url repository (and vcs infos) into location
:param url: the repository URL starting with a vcs prefix. :param verbosity: verbosity level.

Return the url used at location
Raises RemoteNotFoundError if the repository does not have a remote url configured.
Return the current commit id of the files at the given location.

memberdef.argsstring: (cls, Union[List[str], CommandArgs] cmd, bool show_stdout=True, Optional[str] cwd=None, 'Literal["raise", "warn", "ignore"]' on_returncode="raise", Optional[Iterable[int]] extra_ok_returncodes=None, Optional[str] command_desc=None, Optional[Mapping[str, Any]] extra_environ=None, Optional[SpinnerInterface] spinner=None, bool log_failed_cmd=True, bool stdout_only=False)
memberdef.name: run_command

para.verbatim: Run a VCS subcommand This is simply a wrapper around call_subprocess that adds the VCS command name, and checks that the VCS is available
Return whether a directory path is a repository directory.

Return the "root" (top-level) directory controlled by the vcs, or `None` if the directory is not in any.
It is meant to be overridden to implement smarter detection mechanisms for specific vcs.
This can do more than is_repository_directory() alone. For example, the Git override checks that Git is actually available.

Return the base revision arguments for a vcs command.
Args: rev: the name of a revision to install. Cannot be None.
Return the RevOptions "extra arguments" to use in obtain().
Normalize a URL for comparison by unquoting it and removing any trailing slash.
posix absolute paths start with os.path.sep, win32 ones start with drive (like c:\\folder)
